item.title: Beogram 4000: Adjusting the Chassis Springs and the Platter Height
item.description:
The Beogram 4000 restoration is progressing into the final cosmetic stage. With the turntable functioning correctly, the focus is now on refining the exterior and replacing minor parts like the plug. Currently, I am fine-tuning the platter height, tilt, and the leaf springs supporting the turntable’s floating chassis. This is a delicate process with many interconnected factors. The sensor arm’s alignment, platter angle, transport lock travel, and belt tension all need to be perfect for the platter to be level, centered, and parallel to the arms, all while ensuring the chassis clears the open locks...
